parents.father: Cheneviere from le Paire de Taintrux (executed as witch)

devil_mark.description: pinched on forehead and between shoulders

money that was dead leaves and cowdung

master boiled pot on fire after adding powder
dancing to sound of 'guigues et violles'
feasted on unsalted meat and 'oysilons' for dessert
seated close to master for special honor

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused's horses straying on their land and causing damage

after cattle escaped into Clement's field
became ill for 6 weeks after eating two pears given by accused

testimony.threat_quote: que c'estoit une chere gaigere et qu'il s'en repentiroit

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: died after 3 weeks as if rabid

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: Confronted with Claudatte femme George Mengin of la Bolle, already convicted, who claimed she had seen him at sabbat. He said she had lied 'comme une genaxe et une treuye'

timeline.subject: procureur d'office
timeline.details: procureur d'office asks for investigation, to be followed by imprisonment if necessary

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied all charges, claimed to be good Christian

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses - attacked their credibility

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: procureur d'office asks for question ordinaire

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews then racked - did not confess, judges noted he did not seem to feel pain

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: Confronted with Bastien Stablo who confirmed his confessions naming Clement as accomplice. Clement confessed after this confrontation and threat of further torture

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions twice during day

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: procureur d'office asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Clement Cheneviere
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Claudatte femme George Mengin
accomplices_named.context: Already convicted, accused Clement of being at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: wife of Colas le Clerc
accomplices_named.context: Named during confession as accomplice at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Bastien Stablo
accomplices_named.context: Confronted Clement during interrogation, confirmed his own confessions naming Clement

prior_accusations.context: Sister on trial named him and brother Bernard

notable_quotes.speaker: Clement Cheneviere
notable_quotes.french: comme une genaxe et une treuye
notable_quotes.context: Response to Claudatte femme George Mengin's accusation of seeing him at sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean de la Moictresse (Clement's cousin)
notable_quotes.french: Ha le mal bien, ils l'auront assez, il me cottera la vie. et je ne vous servira gueres
notable_quotes.context: Said while dying of illness attributed to Clement

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean de la Moictresse
notable_quotes.french: le mal argent que Clement m'a donné

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Michiel
notable_quotes.french: que c'estoit une chere gaigere et qu'il s'en repentiroit
notable_quotes.context: Threat made by Clement after quarrel over horses

notable_quotes.speaker: Clement Cheneviere
notable_quotes.french: que sy les années continuoyent leurs sterilité en bled, encor deux a trois ans, il ne faudroit que luy pour chasser hors tout le reste des habitans de la Bolle, tant estoient ils pauvres et luy riche
notable_quotes.context: Statement about his wealth compared to other villagers

notable_quotes.speaker: Clement Cheneviere
notable_quotes.french: que peult estre seroient ils sy bon que de le dire, et ainsy demeura le reste du jour sans mot dire, semblant bien vouloir avoir rachepté de qu'il avoit dit
notable_quotes.context: Response when Demenge de Mortaigne said they would call him witch if crop failures continued

notable_quotes.speaker: Colas Demenge Colas Noel
notable_quotes.french: des fumées qui se levoient sur la mer, plaines d'eaue, qui venoient tomber par terre
notable_quotes.context: Clement's explanation of what clouds were on rainy day

notable_quotes.speaker: Clement Cheneviere
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne pensoit qu'il fut sorcier, et que s'il l'estoit il luy diroit, adjoustant estre impossible qu'un homme soit sorcier s'il ne le scait, ou au contraire que s'il l'estoit, il donneroit ses bien a ses enfans, et ne seroit jamais bruslé a Sainct Diez, d'aultant qu'il se retireroit en une chambre au Paire de Taintrux, ne tenant que deux vaches et un cheval
notable_quotes.context: Overheard conversation with wife after sister's execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Bagaire (dying man)
notable_quotes.french: qu'au lieu de lui amener deux anges, on luy amenoit deux diables, et ausquels il n'avoit gueres de fiance, et qu'on les mit hors
notable_quotes.context: Said when Clement and his brother visited him during fatal illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (Percin)
notable_quotes.french: il n'auroit plus affaire de rien

relationships.evidence_text: Father, who had been from le Paire de Taintrux, had been executed as a witch
his sister had been on trial in ban d'Etival
he and his wife came to demand reparation
house of his tuteur, the late Jean Moictrier
hired himself to her husband in order to learn to plough
his brother Bernard, who lived nearby

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: cousin of accused, hired to witness's husband
harms_catalog.harm_description: illness starting with leg so he could hardly walk, spread so covered with spots as if smallpox
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Clement wanted him to return to Allemaigne, he refused; asked for payment of 30 gros he owed, Clement told him to keep money until he was ill
harms_catalog.method_alleged: curse (told him to keep money until ill)

harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft ('le mal argent que Clement m'a donné')

harms_catalog.method_alleged: poisoned pears, then cured by rubbing leg with coat in church

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, blacksmiths unable to save it

cow escaped into field owned by accused, he was angry
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft - recovered after pilgrimage to cross of Perrychamp

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: witness called him witch several times and threatened to have him burned

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Clement Cheneviere (his master did it at his request)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: father was vagabond who angered him by several thefts of pears
had not paid for some animals

wolf on roof of house (claimed by animal trader)

economic value of animals significant to witnesses

legal_context.redress_outcome: obtained reparation from Jean Guenaye who called him witch

emotional_state_notes: returned crying after learning sister's fate
tout esbranlé, et a demy vaincu before confessing
did not seem to feel pain of torture (judges thought devil was helping him)

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: had taken some of his property
homme qui injurie fort souvent les personnes et coustumier de faire reparation, non croyable et recepvable a serment

economic_context.details: Accused was notably wealthier than other villagers - made statement that if crop failures continued 2-3 more years 'il ne faudroit que luy pour chasser hors tout le reste des habitans de la Bolle, tant estoient ils pauvres et luy riche'. After sister's execution, wife worried he would be arrested and he should not buy field. Dispute over 30 gros owed to cousin. Quarrel with Henry Bergier over payment for mare. Confessed he delayed confession 'in fear of losing his property'. Economic value of animals significant - ox worth 50 ecus, mare worth 100 francs, bull bought for 18 francs.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows interesting economic dimensions - accused was notably wealthier than neighbors. Multiple witnesses report wolf sightings associated with accused. Father already executed, sister named him before her execution. Resisted torture (judges thought devil was helping him not feel pain), finally confessed after confrontation with Bastien Stablo. Change de Nancy approved both torture and death sentence. Rich detail on sabbat activities and use of magical powder.
